WPRs like Mangu Ram hope to finally gain full citizenship rights and improve their living conditions.

Activist Labha Ram Gandhi warns that the community is prepared to fight for their rights if necessary.

Yoshinori Muto, an FC Tokyo forward, is considering an offer from Chelsea. Muto wants to ensure that he joins a team where he can play regularly and develop.  Chelsea is reportedly interested in loaning him to Vitesse Arnhem.  Ranko Popovic, Muto's former coach, believes that Muto has the potential to be successful at Chelsea due to his intelligence, speed, strength, and confidence.  Jose Mourinho has stated that while commercial interests are a factor in Chelsea's transfer policy, the club would only sign a player who is good or has good potential.

England's rugby team should select its best players, regardless of where they play, in order to optimize performance and increase the chance of winning the World Cup.  Many players have improved their game by playing overseas, including Jonny Wilkinson, Steffon Armitage, and Nick Abendanon. Other countries, like Australia and South Africa, select their best players regardless of where they play, and England should do the same. If England loses the World Cup with overseas-based players performing well for other countries, it will be a major cause for regret. The English Rugby Football Union and Premiership Rugby should not be allowed to dictate who can and cannot be selected for the national team. The best players should be selected, and that's how England will have the best chance to win.

Open Garden, the developers of FireChat, have created a device called Greenstone to improve off-the-grid networks. FireChat, downloaded over 5 million times, allows users to communicate without internet or mobile signals by using Apple's Multipeer Connectivity Framework or a similar Android feature. It creates a wireless mesh network where phones act as nodes, passing data between each other within a limited range. Greenstone, an egg-shaped device, acts as a beacon to extend the range of these networks. It could be used in areas with unreliable connectivity or where large crowds overload networks. Greenstone is still under development, with a limited range and compatibility only with FireChat. Open Garden is collaborating with manufacturers to produce and sell Greenstone.

Lillian Bustle, a burlesque performer, is challenging the negative connotations associated with the word "fat" by embracing it as a positive descriptor of her own body. In a TED Talk, she advocates for body positivity, arguing that "fat" is simply an adjective like "short" or "wife."  She highlights the pervasiveness of size discrimination, noting its increase in the workplace and the desire among young girls to be thinner. However, she also points to research suggesting that exposure to diverse body types leads to greater acceptance. Through burlesque, Lillian aims to showcase a "fat" body in a positive and glamorous light, encouraging audiences to rethink conventional beauty standards.  Her performances have been empowering and body-positive experiences for her, helping her overcome insecurities and build self-esteem.  Lillian's TED Talk has garnered a largely positive response, with many viewers expressing gratitude for her message of body acceptance and its impact on their self-perception.

Theo Walcott and six of his Arsenal teammates: Calum Chambers, Jack Wilshere, Mikel Arteta, David Ospina, Mathieu Flamini, and Mesut Ozil, were recently photographed in an official portrait for Paris' oldest fashion house - Lanvin. Lanvin has been the club's official tailor since 2013. The Arsenal first team will be dressed in Lanvin attire at the FA Cup final against Aston Villa on May 30th. Walcott has mostly been on the bench this season but hopes to make his first start since March 14th when the Gunners face Hull.

A collection of props and puppets from films such as *Men in Black*, *Batman Forever*, and *How the Grinch Stole Christmas*, created by legendary make-up effects artist Rick Baker, will be auctioned off at the Hilton Universal City in Los Angeles, California and online at Propstore.com on May 29th. The collection from Baker’s Cinovation Studio is estimated to be worth $746,100, with some individual items expected to fetch over $40,000. The 417 original items come from more than 50 productions spanning Baker’s 30-year career. Other films represented in the auction include *An American Werewolf in London*, *Planet of the Apes*, *Batman & Robin*, *Hellboy*, and *Mighty Joe Young*, as well as items from Michael Jackson’s 1988 film *Moonwalker* and his 1983 *Thriller* music video.

Carwyn Scott-Howell, a 7-year-old boy from Wales, died while skiing with his family in the French Alps when he became separated from his mother and fell down a 164ft drop.  His body was found by following his footprints in the snow.  Carwyn's family described him as a daring and outgoing boy who loved the outdoors. They are devastated by his death.

15-year-old Laura Scurr developed anorexia after being bullied about her weight and feeling pressure to be thin. Her condition worsened to the point where she was only eating around 100 calories a day, primarily fruit. This led to her collapsing and being hospitalized with a dangerously slow heart rate. After receiving support from eating disorder organizations and mental health services, Laura is now in recovery and has a healthier body image. She has even reached the semi-finals of Miss Teen GB, a competition that promotes positive body image and avoids size zero stereotypes. Anorexia is a serious mental health condition affecting approximately 725,000 people in the UK, with sufferers often restricting food intake and/or excessively exercising.  It commonly develops in those anxious about their weight and body shape, particularly young women aged 16-17. If you suspect someone is suffering from anorexia, it's important to talk to them gently and consider seeking advice from eating disorder charities like Beat.

Liverpool unveiled their new home kit, designed by New Balance, at Anfield. Raheem Sterling, despite recent contract disputes, was present at the unveiling alongside teammates. Fans urged Sterling to stay with the club next season. The new kit features white branding and a new collar style. It also includes a tribute to the Hillsborough disaster victims. Sterling's future at Liverpool remains uncertain, but the club hopes he will stay.

University of Manchester researchers created the largest high-definition map of dark matter, which is an invisible substance comprising 80% of the universe’s matter. The map, created using data from the Dark Energy Camera, displays dark matter distribution across 0.4% of the sky, with the goal of mapping 12.5% over 5 years.  The map aids astronomers in studying galaxy formation and the nature of dark energy, which is believed to be accelerating the universe's expansion. The team analyzed 130 million galaxy images, utilizing supercomputers to measure galaxy shapes and map dark matter distribution based on its gravitational effects on light. The project, part of the 5-year Dark Energy Survey, suggests that galaxies form near large concentrations of dark matter due to stronger gravity. Future research aims to test cosmological theories by comparing dark and visible matter amounts and examining the interplay between mass and light.

Manchester United are attempting to sign Memphis Depay, a 21-year-old player for PSV Eindhoven.  PSV confirmed the approach from Manchester United. The team's manager, Louis Van Gaal, knows Depay well, having coached him on the Netherlands National team.  Depay has scored 20 goals in 26 games this season for PSV.  Depay is a fast and skilled player with an explosive right foot.  He has been compared to Cristiano Ronaldo and Arjen Robben.  Depay made his debut for the Netherlands National team in 2013 and was part of the 2014 World Cup team.

Chelsea defeated Manchester City 3-1 in a youth soccer game. Tammy Abraham scored two goals and Dominic Solanke scored one for Chelsea. Isaac Buckley-Ricketts scored the lone goal for City.  Several players stood out in the game. On the City side, Tosin Adarabioyo had a commanding presence at the heart of defense. Brandon Barker was a dynamic two-footed player who created several chances. On the Chelsea side, Tammy Abraham scored two goals and was a force up front before leaving the game with an injury. Charlie Colkett had a strong game in the midfield.  Overall, Chelsea was the stronger team and deserved the victory.

Marco Rubio, a Republican presidential candidate, believes that marriage should be between a man and a woman, but does not think it is a constitutional right. Although he believes people are born with their sexual preference, he thinks that states should decide whether or not to allow gay marriage. He would attend a same-sex wedding of a family member or staffer, even if he didn't agree with their decision.

Pablo and Ilze are a couple who have embarked on an open-ended cycling journey around the world. They have been traveling for over a year and have covered almost 7,000 miles through 16 countries. They live on a budget of less than three euros each per day by camping, using hosting websites, and eating inexpensive food. They plan to continue their journey through Asia and across the Americas.

A Texas couple is suing Premiere Photos after discovering a racial slur printed on their wedding photo booth pictures. The couple alleges that Premiere Photos owner, James Evans, printed "poor n***** party" on the photos. Attorney Cathy Hale represents the couple and claims Evans refused to apologize and told the couple to sue him. Evans denies the allegations, stating there's no evidence linking his company to the slur. The couple seeks an apology and is suing under the Texas Deceptive Trade Practices Act for negligence and breach of contract. Mediation is scheduled, and if unsuccessful, the case will go to trial in July.

Mike Brown, the England full-back, is taking a cautious approach to recovering from his latest concussion, sustained after the France game. He experienced headaches and didn't feel right, leading him to pull out of Harlequins' game against Saracens. Brown's decision was influenced by the cases of other players like George North and Johnny Sexton, who have suffered from multiple concussions, and increased awareness of concussion symptoms through World Rugby's online modules. He highlights the importance of recognizing symptoms and not rushing back to action, emphasizing the potential long-term dangers of repeated concussions.

A decline in the frequency of sex among Britons has been observed since the emergence of the internet. Possible factors include increased time spent online and a blurring of boundaries between work and personal life, leading to less time for intimacy and decreased prioritization of sex.

Tibetan Mastiffs, which were once highly valued in China and could be sold for up to £1.2 million, have drastically decreased in popularity and are now being sent to slaughterhouses for their meat and skin. This decline is attributed to the Chinese government's anti-corruption crackdown, which discouraged using the dogs as gifts for officials, and bans on owning large dogs in several cities. Unscrupulous breeders who damaged the breed's quality for profit and the dogs' unsuitability for city living have also contributed to their decline.

A survey of 600 women in Paris revealed that all had experienced sexual harassment or assault on public transportation, often before the age of 18. This harassment, ranging from verbal abuse to physical assault, can significantly impact women's lives, causing them to alter their routines and limit their freedom. The High Council for Gender Equality has called for a campaign to address the issue and educate the public on appropriate behavior and the legal consequences of sexual harassment and assault. The council emphasized that women have the right to feel safe in public spaces.

Direct Line's #EverydayFix competition seeks to design products that address common daily problems. Three prototypes were shortlisted: Snooze, an alarm clock silencing phone notifications; Forget Me Lock, a key attachment indicating whether a door is locked; and Nipper, a small phone charger using household batteries. The competition winner, determined by Twitter retweets, will be funded through Kickstarter. The project showcases innovative solutions to everyday challenges, like forgetting to lock doors or running out of phone battery.

Vera Baird, the Northumbria Police and Crime Commissioner, is under investigation by the Ministry of Justice for allocating £500,000 to Victims First Northumbria, a charity where she is a director alongside Northumbria Chief Constable Sue Sim. Critics, including Keith Vaz, Labour chairman of the Home Affairs Committee, cite potential conflicts of interest, deeming it inappropriate for a PCC to use public funds for an organization in which they have a vested interest. Ms. Baird defends her decision, stating that all protocols were followed.  The Ministry of Justice will investigate if any conflict of interest rules were violated. This follows a new rule allowing PCCs to commission services for crime victims.  Additionally, Ms. Sim's involvement raises concerns as she was previously accused of bullying and faced an investigation led by Ms. Baird.  Ms. Sim recently announced her June retirement, which some speculate is linked to the Victims First Northumbria controversy.

In March 2014, a group of individuals, led by Corry Campbell, assaulted Greg Valecce in a Philadelphia basement. The group, dubbed the "tattoo terrorists," believed Valecce had harmed Campbell's cat. Over a period of roughly 42 hours, Valecce was beaten, tied to a chair, and forcibly tattooed with offensive symbols and phrases. Three of the perpetrators, including Campbell, have been sentenced to prison, while two others await sentencing or trial. Valecce sustained severe injuries and continues to suffer psychological trauma from the incident.

Manchester United has officially approached PSV Eindhoven to acquire Memphis Depay, a 21-year-old Dutch player.  PSV confirmed the bid from Manchester United, and there is additional interest from Paris Saint-Germain and an unnamed third team.  Depay has scored 20 goals in 26 games this season for PSV.  Depay is a fast and skilled player with an explosive right foot who has been compared to Cristiano Ronaldo and Arjen Robben.  He was part of the Netherlands World Cup team in 2014.

Chelsea defeated Manchester City 3-1 in a youth soccer match. Tammy Abraham scored two goals for Chelsea, and Dominic Solanke added a third. Isaac Buckley-Ricketts scored the lone goal for City.

Chelsea's strong performance was led by Abraham and Solanke, as well as a solid defensive effort. City struggled to create chances, and their lone goal came from a set piece.

Notable performers for Chelsea included:
* Tammy Abraham: Scored two goals and was a constant threat.
* Dominic Solanke: Scored a goal and worked well with Abraham.
* Ola Aina: Provided width and attacking support from right-back.
* Jake Clarke-Salter: Defended well and was difficult to beat.
* Jay Dasilva: Solid defensively and provided good crosses going forward.
* Ruben Sammut: Protected the back four effectively and started attacks.
* Charlie Colkett: Controlled the midfield.

Notable performers for City included:
* Isaac Buckley-Ricketts: Scored City's only goal.
* Brandon Barker: Showed flashes of skill but was inconsistent.
* Tosin Adarabioyo: A commanding presence in defense.
* Cameron Humphreys-Grant

Marco Rubio, a presidential candidate, believes that while sexual preference is something people are born with, marriage should be between a man and a woman. He supports states' rights to define marriage and opposes the idea of same-sex marriage as a constitutional right. Despite his personal views, he stated that he would attend the same-sex wedding of a family member or staff member. Also, he mentioned that his campaign donors have already pledged over $47 million.

Pablo and Ilze are a couple who are cycling around the world on a budget of less than three euros a day. They have been on the road for over a year and have covered almost 7,000 miles. They keep costs down by camping, using hosting websites, and eating cheaply. They plan to continue cycling for the next few years and eventually cross the Pacific and cycle the length of the American continent.

Mike Brown, England full-back, is taking a cautious approach to recovering from his latest concussion. Brown pulled out of Harlequins' game against Saracens due to experiencing symptoms after the France game. He is unsure when he will return but is following return-to-play protocols. He emphasized the importance of concussion awareness, highlighting that he withdrew from the Ireland game despite it being a crucial match. Brown's decision was influenced by online modules about concussion symptoms and the potential long-term dangers. He believes that no player should risk playing with concussion symptoms, urging teammates to prioritize their health.

The frequency of sex among Britons has declined since the emergence of the internet. A Cambridge statistician, Professor David Spiegelhalter, suggests that increased smartphone use and connectivity may be to blame. This is because the boundaries between work and personal life have become blurred, leaving less time for intimacy. Another possible factor is the increasing number of people living alone. The decline in sexual activity can also be attributed to competing demands on time, with sex becoming less of a priority for many couples.

Tibetan Mastiffs, which were once highly prized and expensive in China, have recently experienced a dramatic fall in popularity and value. This is due to multiple factors, including China's anti-corruption crackdown, which has made them less desirable as gifts, and bans on large dogs in major cities. As a result, many Tibetan Mastiffs are now being sent to slaughterhouses for their meat and skin, or abandoned by breeders unable to sell them. The breed's decline is further fueled by overbreeding, which has led to a surplus of lower-quality dogs. Additionally, increased urbanization has made it more difficult to keep these large dogs in cities.

Direct Line's #EverydayFix competition seeks to design products that address common daily problems. Three prototype products were shortlisted from designs submitted by Makerversity: Snooze, a notification-silencing alarm clock; Forget Me Lock, a key attachment indicating whether a door is locked; and Nipper, a small phone charger powered by household batteries. The competition winner, determined by Twitter retweets, will be funded through Kickstarter. The top three everyday emergencies identified were difficulty sleeping, losing keys, and traffic delays. Other designs that didn't make the shortlist include a helmet with bone conduction headphones for directions, a parking space notification pin, and a message relay app for dead phones.
